channel.title: Oci User on TheKoguryo's Tech Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Oci User on TheKoguryo's Tech Blog

item.title: 3.1 Creating a Work Compartment
item.description: 3.1 Creating a Work Compartment A compartment can be thought of as a folder structure as a logical concept that makes it easy to manage resources. When a tenancy is created, the first Root Compartment is created, and administrators can add a new Compartment as a child of the Root Compartment. All OCI resources fall into a specific Compartment and can manage the access policies of their users in units of Compartment.

item.title: 6.2 Creating Users
item.description: 6.2 Create User Tips Users who can access OCI are mainly IDCS users and OCI users. OCI is connected to Identity Cloud Service by default, so IDCS users can be federated and logged in. And IDCS is not registered, it has its own users only in OCI. The content here is intended only for users of OCI itself. Add OCI Manager Step 1. Add OCI Manager Open the navigation menu in the OCI console.
